intro: Xanthophyllum griffithii subsp. erectum, commonly known as the upright xanthophyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and distinctive yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is native to certain regions of South Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
